recent_posts.title: BIP for Serverless Payjoin
recent_posts.summary:
- This email provides an update on Serverless Payjoin and Payjoin version 2 specification.
- The draft includes proof of concept implementations, a new protocol, and messaging details.
- It aims to increase transaction privacy, throughput, and coordination in various wallet environments.

recent_posts.title: Multipath Keysend
recent_posts.summary:
- ZmnSCPxj proposed a scheme for creating a `keysend` protocol with multipath payments.
- The receiver can claim the payment only when all parts have arrived, using the preimage.
- This scheme allows for dynamic splitting and does not require announcing support.

recent_posts.title: Specification Meeting Transcripts

- I'm pleased to announce that our team has been consistently recording and transcribing our specification meetings since the start of the year.

- Special thanks to Gurwinder at Chaincode for reviewing the transcripts and maintaining their accuracy.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- The email discusses the implementation of 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains.
- The security of the blinded statechains relies on trusting the statechain server to report the number of signatures generated.
- Party 1 is fully blinded and does not learn certain information about the signing process.

active_posts.title: Ark: An Alternative Privacy-preserving Second Layer Solution
active_posts.summary:
- Ark is a second-layer protocol alternative to the Lightning network, allowing liquidity-free transactions.
- Instead of opening and closing channels, Ark uses virtual UTXOs (vTXOs) that must be spent within four weeks.
- Ark enables anonymous, off-chain payments through intermediaries called Ark Service Providers (ASPs).

active_posts.title: Pull-req to enable Full-RBF by default
active_posts.summary:
- The author wants to enable full-replace-by-fee (full-rbf) by default in Bitcoin Core.
- Block explorers, nodes, and wallets already support full-rbf, but it's not widely relayed.
- Bitrefill's opposition to full-rbf has been debunked, and the author proposes enabling it by default.

active_posts.title: Potential vulnerability in Lightning backends: BOLT-11 "payment hash" does not commit to payment!
active_posts.summary:
- The LNbits team patched an exploit allowing attackers to create balances using invoices.
- Users are advised to update to LNbits version 0.10.5 to protect against this exploit.
- Developers should be aware of the attack and take measures to prevent similar exploits.

active_posts.title: Blinded Paths Doom Scenario
active_posts.summary:
- Blinded paths in the Lightning Network provide privacy benefits for receiving nodes.
- Payments can only be made through given paths, potentially favoring "compliant" nodes.
- This approach raises concerns about decentralization, privacy, and pressure from chain analysis companies.
